title: New number crunchers hired to help with ECA accounts
text:
How many accounting firms does it take to get an initial public offering contender's accounts in order?

The answer is two if you are university pathways and partnerships company Education Centres of Australia, which still holds out hope for a sharemarket listing this year.

While one firm would normally be enough and ECA had hired Deloitte to audit its books and prepare the Investigating Accountant's Report on that basis, sources said a second set of hands was recently added.

International students specialist Education Centres of Australia wants to be trading on the ASX-boards by the end of the year. Andrew Quilty

The second set of hands is KPMG, which is said to be helping check and double check the numbers in light of ECA's decision to change its annual balance date.

While that may be the case, the addition of a second firm would suggest ECA may be struggling with the transition from a family-owned company to a listed entity. Getting a newbie's finance function and reporting systems up to listed company standards is a pre-requisite for any IPO preparation plan.
description: How many accounting firms does it take to get an initial public offering contender's accounts in order?
